case_title: Mian ALl NAWAZ AND 20 OTHERS vs MAUD HUSSAIN AND 28 OTHERS
legal_basis: Section 13 of the Consolidation of Holdings Ordinance, 1960

summary.issue: Dispute over partition and ownership of shamlat land in village Hassu Balail, Tehsil Shorkot, District Jhang.
summary.background: Consolidation operations began in 1980, and the final scheme was confirmed in 1981. The respondents challenged the partition of shamlat land attached to nine wells, claiming exclusive ownership based on historical records.
key_findings: The land attached to the wells was conditionally granted to the respondents' predecessors in 1880.
The ownership was subject to conditions outlined in the Wajib-ul-Arz of 1880, 1903-4, and 1924-25.
The Additional Commissioner (Cons.) erred in disregarding these conditions and relying solely on the last jamabandi (1974-75).
summary.decision: The revision petition was allowed, and the order of the Additional Commissioner (Cons.), dated 27-9-1982, was set aside.

key_points.land_dispute: Shamlat land measuring 3,019 Kanals, 12 Marlas attached to nine wells.
key_points.historical_context: Ownership conditions were established during British-era settlements in 1880, 1903-4, and 1924-25.
key_points.legal_principle: Rights of parties are governed by Wajib-ul-Arz entries from the last settlement, not just ownership entries in subsequent jamabandis.
